t: Matthew 26
The Plot to Kill Jesus
Now*p it came to pass, when Jesus had finished all these sayings, that*i He said to His disciples,
“You*r know*r that*r after*r two*r days*r is*r the*r Passover,*r and*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r be*r delivered*r up*r to*r be*r crucified.”*r
Then*p the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders of the people assembled at the palace of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas,
and plotted to take Jesus by trickery and kill Him.*i
But they said, “Not during the feast, lest there be an uproar among the people.”
The Anointing at Bethany
And*p when Jesus was in Bethany at the house of Simon the leper,
a woman came to Him having an alabaster flask of very costly fragrant oil, and she poured it*i on His head as He sat at*i the*i table.*i
But when His disciples saw it,*i they were indignant, saying, “Why this waste?
For this fragrant oil might have been sold for much and given to the*i poor.”
But*p when Jesus was aware of it,*i He said to them, “Why*r do*r you*r trouble*r the*r woman?*r For*r she*r has*r done*r a*r good*r work*r for*r Me.*r
For*r you*r have*r the*r poor*r with*r you*r always,*r but*r Me*r you*r do*r not*r have*r always.*r
For*r in*r pouring*r this*r fragrant*r oil*r on*r My*r body,*r she*r did*r it*ir for*r My*r burial.*r
Assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r wherever*r this*r gospel*r is*r preached*r in*r the*r whole*r world,*r what*r this*r woman*r has*r done*r will*r also*r be*r told*r as*r a*r memorial*r to*r her.”*r
Judas Agrees to Betray Jesus
Then*p one of the twelve, called Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests
and said, “What are you willing to give me if I deliver Him to you?” And they counted out to him thirty pieces of silver.
So from that time he sought opportunity to betray Him.
Jesus Celebrates Passover with His Disciples
Now*p on the first day*i of*i the*i Feast*i of Unleavened Bread the disciples came to Jesus, saying to Him, “Where do You want us to prepare for You to eat the Passover?”

And*p He said, “Go*r into*r the*r city*r to*r a*r certain*r man,*r and*r say*r to*r him,*r ‘The*r Teacher*r says,*r “My*r time*r is*r at*r hand;*r I*r will*r keep*r the*r Passover*r at*r your*r house*r with*r My*r disciples.”’”*r
So*p the disciples did as Jesus had directed them; and they prepared the Passover.
When*p evening had come, He sat down with the twelve.
Now as they were eating, He said, “Assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r one*r of*r you*r will*r betray*r Me.”*r
And*p they were exceedingly sorrowful, and each of them began to say to Him, “Lord, is it I?”
He*p answered and said, “He*r who*r dipped*r his*ir hand*r with*r Me*r in*r the*r dish*r will*r betray*r Me.*r

The*r Son*r of*r Man*r indeed*r goes*r just*r as*r it*r is*r written*r of*r Him,*r but*r woe*r to*r that*r man*r by*r whom*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r betrayed!*r It*r would*r have*r been*r good*r for*r that*r man*r if*r he*r had*r not*r been*r born.”*r
Then*p Judas, who was betraying Him, answered and said, “Rabbi, is it I?” He*p said to him, “You*r have*r said*r it.”*r
Jesus Institutes the Lord’s Supper
And*p as they were eating, Jesus took bread, blessed and broke it,*i and gave it*i to the disciples and said, “Take,*r eat;*r this*r is*r My*r body.”*r
Then*p He took the cup, and gave thanks, and gave it*i to them, saying, “Drink*r from*r it,*r all*r of*r you.*r
For*r this*r is*r My*r blood*r of*r the*r new*r covenant,*r which*r is*r shed*r for*r many*r for*r the*r remission*r of*r sins.*r

But*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r I*r will*r not*r drink*r of*r this*r fruit*r of*r the*r vine*r from*r now*r on*r until*r that*r day*r when*r I*r drink*r it*r new*r with*r you*r in*r My*r Father’s*r kingdom.”*r
And*p when they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
Jesus Predicts Peter’s Denial

Then*p Jesus said to them, “All*r of*r you*r will*r be*r made*r to*r stumble*r because*r of*r Me*r this*r night,*r for*r it*r is*r written:*r ‘I*rpn will*r strike*r the*r Shepherd,*r And*rld the*r sheep*r of*r the*r flock*r will*r be*r scattered.’*r
But*rp after*r I*r have*r been*r raised,*r I*r will*r go*r before*r you*r to*r Galilee.”*r
Peter*p answered and said to Him, “Even if all are made to stumble because of You, I will never be made to stumble.”
Jesus*p said to him, “Assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you*r that*r this*r night,*r before*r the*r rooster*r crows,*r you*r will*r deny*r Me*r three*r times.”*r
Peter*p said to Him, “Even if I have to die with You, I will not deny You!” And*p so said all the disciples.
The Prayer in the Garden
Then*p Jesus came with them to a place called Gethsemane, and said to the disciples, “Sit*r here*r while*r I*r go*r and*r pray*r over*r there.”*r
And He took with Him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and He began to be sorrowful and deeply distressed.
Then He said to them, “My*r soul*r is*r exceedingly*r sorrowful,*r even*r to*r death.*r Stay*r here*r and*r watch*r with*r Me.”*r

He*p went a little farther and fell on His face, and prayed, saying, “O*r My*r Father,*r if*r it*r is*r possible,*r let*r this*r cup*r pass*r from*r Me;*r nevertheless,*r not*r as*r I*r will,*r but*r as*r You*r will.”*ir
Then*p He came to the disciples and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, “What!*r Could*r you*r not*r watch*r with*r Me*r one*r hour?*r
Watch*r and*r pray,*r lest*r you*r enter*r into*r temptation.*r The*r spirit*r indeed*r is*ir willing,*r but*r the*r flesh*r is*ir weak.”*r
Again,*p a second time, He went away and prayed, saying, “O*r My*r Father,*r if*r this*r cup*r cannot*r pass*r away*r from*r Me*r unless*r I*r drink*r it,*r Your*r will*r be*r done.”*r
And He came and found them asleep again, for their eyes were heavy.
So*p He left them, went away again, and prayed the third time, saying the same words.

Then He came to His disciples and said to them, “Are*r you*ir still*r sleeping*r and*r resting?*r Behold,*r the*r hour*r is*r at*r hand,*r and*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r being*r betrayed*r into*r the*r hands*r of*r sinners.*r
Rise,*r let*r us*r be*r going.*r See,*r My*r betrayer*r is*r at*r hand.”*r
Betrayal and Arrest in Gethsemane
And*p while He was still speaking, behold, Judas, one of the twelve, with a great multitude with swords and clubs, came from the chief priests and elders of the people.
Now*p His betrayer had given them a sign, saying, “Whomever I kiss, He is the One; seize Him.”
Immediately he went up to Jesus and said, “Greetings, Rabbi!” and kissed Him.
But*p Jesus said to him, “Friend,*r why*r have*r you*r come?”*r Then*p they came and laid hands on Jesus and took Him.
And suddenly, one of those who*i were*i with Jesus stretched out his*i hand and drew his sword, struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.
But*p Jesus said to him, “Put*r your*r sword*r in*r its*r place,*r for*r all*r who*r take*r the*r sword*r will*r perish*r by*r the*r sword.*r
Or*r do*r you*r think*r that*r I*r cannot*r now*r pray*r to*r My*r Father,*r and*r He*r will*r provide*r Me*r with*r more*r than*r twelve*r legions*r of*r angels?*r
How*r then*r could*r the*r Scriptures*r be*r fulfilled,*r that*r it*r must*r happen*r thus?”*r

In*p that hour Jesus said to the multitudes, “Have*r you*r come*r out,*r as*r against*r a*r robber,*r with*r swords*r and*r clubs*r to*r take*r Me?*r I*r sat*r daily*r with*r you,*r teaching*r in*r the*r temple,*r and*r you*r did*r not*r seize*r Me.*r
But*r all*r this*r was*r done*r that*r the*r Scriptures*r of*r the*r prophets*r might*r be*r fulfilled.”*r Then*p all the disciples forsook Him and fled.
Jesus Faces the Sanhedrin
And*p those who had laid hold of Jesus led Him*i away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were assembled.
But Peter followed Him at a distance to the high priest’s courtyard. And he went in and sat with the servants to see the end.
Now*p the chief priests, the elders, and all the council sought false testimony against Jesus to put Him to death,
but found none. Even though many false witnesses came forward, they found none. But at last two false witnesses came forward
and said, “This fellow*i said, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God and to build it in three days.’”
And*p the high priest arose and said to Him, “Do You answer nothing? What is*i it*i these men testify against You?”
But Jesus kept silent. And the high priest answered and said to Him, “I put You under oath by the living God: Tell us if You are the Christ, the Son of God!”

Jesus*p said to him, “It*ir is*ir as*ir you*r said.*r Nevertheless,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r hereafter*r you*r will*r see*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r sitting*r at*r the*r right*r hand*r of*r the*r Power,*r and*r coming*r on*r the*r clouds*r of*r heaven.”*r
Then*p the high priest tore his clothes, saying, “He has spoken blasphemy! What further need do we have of witnesses? Look, now you have heard His blasphemy!
What do you think?” They*p answered and said, “He is deserving of death.”
Then*p they spat in His face and beat Him; and others struck Him*i with the palms of their hands,
saying, “Prophesy to us, Christ! Who is the one who struck You?”
Peter Denies Jesus, and Weeps Bitterly
Now*p Peter sat outside in the courtyard. And a servant girl came to him, saying, “You also were with Jesus of Galilee.”
But*p he denied it before them*i all, saying, “I do not know what you are saying.”
And*p when he had gone out to the gateway, another girl*i saw him and said to those who*i were*i there, “This fellow*i also was with Jesus of Nazareth.”
But*p again he denied with an oath, “I do not know the Man!”
And*p a little later those who stood by came up and said to Peter, “Surely you also are one*i of them, for your speech betrays you.”
Then*p he began to curse and swear, saying,*i “I do not know the Man!” Immediately*p a rooster crowed.
And Peter remembered the word of Jesus who had said to him, “Before*r the*r rooster*r crows,*r you*r will*r deny*r Me*r three*r times.”*r So he went out and wept bitterly.
